text.section:
During a time of duty, a commanding officer may arrest for the period of the time of duty an individual who:
trespasses on a camp ground, parade ground, armory, or other place devoted to that duty;
disrupts in any way the orderly discharge of duty by those under arms; or
interrupts or prevents the passage of troops going to or returning from duty.

A commanding officer may prohibit within the limits of a post, camp ground, place of encampment, parade, or drill that is under the command of the officer:
the sale or use of alcoholic beverages;
huckster or auction sales; and
gambling.
